name: console
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make someone who is sad or disappointed feel better, usually by giving them comfort or sympathy: Her friends tried to console her, telling her "Everything will be fine." He was consoled by the fact that he was young enough to try again the following year. I consoled myself with the thought that no one else could have done any better. Synonyms
comfort
solace literary
soothe
More examplesFewer examplesShe appeared shocked and began crying as her attorney tried to console her.Console yourself with the knowledge that you are right.The one thing that consoled him at that time was writing poetry.

console noun [C]
(EQUIPMENT)
a surface or device with controls for electronic equipment, a vehicle, etc.: A sound engineer's console looks as complicated as the cockpit of a jet aircraft.
(also game console, gaming console) a piece of electronic equipment for playing computer games: It's the only console that will run this game. The early model was a $40 game console that plugged directly into your TV.
More examplesFewer examplesTo raise or lower the seats, you simply depress a button on the console.A flat-screen TV is positioned above the driver's console.The surgeon sits at the console and uses his hands to guide the instruments.These are the people who will be behind the consoles for the next space mission.You can get a backpack designed specifically to carry your console, so you're never far from your games.Have you experienced the immersive addictiveness of a high-end game console?The company unveiled its sleek new gaming console.

console noun [C]
(TABLE)
(also console table) a type of narrow table, sometimes fixed to a wall: You could try adding a mirrored top to a hallway table or a console. Console tables are ideal for narrow passageways.
More examplesFewer examplesA marble bust stands on the console.I bought a console table with two drawers for the hallway.

console verb [T]
(COMFORT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to give comfort and sympathy to someone who is sad or disappointed: The boys consoled one another after their team’s first defeat.
console noun [C]
(CONTROLS)
a special area containing a set of controls for electric equipment, esp. on an aircraft or boat: The jet’s console contains dozens of dials, meters, and switches.
A console is also a cabinet that sits on the floor and contains an electrical unit such as a television.
